sen.j: 鯨肉（げいにく） とは、食品として扱われるクジラ目や、その小型種の一部の総称であるイルカの可食部全般を指す。
sen.e: Whale meat indicates the eatable portions of cetaceans and of smaller-sized cetaceans called dolphins, which are dealt with food.
Whale meat is defined as the edible parts of cetaceans and of smaller-sized cetaceans called dolphins, which are used for food.

sen.e: Whale meat is defined as the edible parts of cetaceans and of smaller-sized cetaceans called dolphins, which are used for food.

sen.j: 狭義にはイルカ類は除く。
sen.e: In the narrow sense, those of dolphins are excluded.

sen.j: 筋肉・内臓・鯨類特有の脂皮（脂肪層）などを含む。
sen.e: The meat includes muscles and internal organs of whales, and fat layers specific to whales.
The meat includes muscles and internal organs of whales, and fat layers specific to whales.

sen.j: 鯨類は世界各地で鯨油など多様な利用がされてきたが、鯨肉もその中の重要な用途の一つである。
sen.e: Whales have been used by human beings in various ways throughout the world, including use of their oil, and use of whale meat is an important one of them.
Whales have been used by human beings in various ways throughout the world, including use of their oil, and use of whale meat is an important one of them.

sen.j: 多様な鯨種と食味や鯨肉の名称にあわせて様々な嗜好や調理法も生まれ、国や地域によって様々な食文化を形成してきた。
sen.e: Variously tasted foods, consequently the cooking methods for them, have been developed in combination with the meat tastes of various types of whales and of body portions of whales, having formed various food cultures depending on the nation or area.

Various taste preferences, consequently the cooking methods for them, have been developed in combination with the meat tastes of various types of whales and of body portions of whales, having formed various food cultures depending on the nation or area.

sen.j: 現在では商業捕鯨が大きく制限されているため、生産量が減少している。
sen.e: Nowadays, since commercial whaling is restricted considerably, the amount of whale meat produced has decreased.

sen.j: しかしながら、日本ではそれ以上に食用需要が減少しているため、流通不安はないとされる。
sen.e: However, in Japan, demand for whale meat for eating has declined more rapidly than the production, and therefore, it is said that no anxiety exists about the availability of the meat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in Japan, demand for whale meat as food is decreasing more rapidly than the production, and therefore, it is said that anxiety regarding availability of whale meat doesn't exist.

sen.j: 価格も商業捕鯨全盛期と比べると大きく値上がりしており、その高騰が捕鯨問題と関連して争点となる場合がある。
sen.e: The meat price has risen considerably in comparison with that in the golden age of commercial whaling, and the steep rise has sometimes been disputed in relation to the problem of whaling.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The meat price has risen considerably in comparison with that in the golden age of commercial whaling, and the steep rise has sometimes been disputed in relation to the problem of whaling.

sen.j: しかしながら、値上がりの主因は産業構造の変化によるものである。
sen.e: However, the main factor of the rise is due to structural changes in the industry.

sen.j: 鯨はしばしば最大の「魚」ととらえられ、魚肉のひとつという位置づけで古くから食用とされてきた。
sen.e: Because whales have often been considered as big "fishes," the meat has been eaten as a type of fish meat, from old times.
Because whales have often been considered as big "fishes," the meat has been eaten as a type of fish meat, from old times.

sen.j: そのため、以下の記述では哺乳類の鯨を「魚」として表記する場合がある。
sen.e: Therefore, in the article below, whales, actually in the mammal class, are sometimes described as fishes as well.
Therefore, in the article below, whales, actually in the mammal class, are sometimes described as fishes as well.

sen.e: History of food cultures in Europe and in the United States

sen.j: 世界各地の沿岸部で古くから鯨肉を食していたことは、考古学的研究から判明している。
sen.e: It has been known from archeological studies that whale meat was eaten from old times in coastal areas of the world.
It has been known from archeological studies that whale meat was eaten from old times in coastal areas of the world.
It has been known from archeological studies that whale meat was eaten from old times in coastal areas of the world.

sen.j: 中世ヨーロッパにおいてはビスケー湾などで組織的な捕鯨が行われ、鯨の舌が珍重されたほか、肉は広く沿岸民の食糧となった。
sen.e: In the medieval period of Europe, whales were hunt systematically, for example, in Bay of Biscay, and the meat was consumed as food widely by people living along the costal areas, with their tongues valued especially highly.

In the medieval period of Europe, whales were hunt systematically, for example, in Bay of Biscay, and the meat was consumed as food widely by people living along the costal areas, especially whale tongue was highly valued.

sen.e: In the medieval period of Europe, whales were hunt systematically, for example, in Bay of Biscay, and the meat was consumed as food widely by people living along the costal areas, especially whale tongue was highly valued.

sen.j: 特にイルカが食用として好まれ、串焼きやプディング、パイなどに用いられた。
sen.e: Dolphin meat in particular was favored for puddings, pies or being roasted on skewers,.
Dolphin meat in particular was favored for puddings, pies or spit-roasted dishes.
sen.cmt: 下記の1点変更しました。being roasted on skewers,→spit-roasted dishes
sen.e: Dolphin meat in particular was favored for puddings, pies or spit-roasted dishes.

sen.j: 変わった料理法では、捕鯨船などでまれに供されたイルカの脳みそのフライが挙げられる。
sen.e: As an unusual cooking method example, the fried brains of dolphins were eaten on whaling ships on rare occasions.
As an unusual cooking method example, the fried brains of dolphins were eaten on whaling ships on rare occasions.
As an unusual cooking method example, the fried brains of dolphins were eaten on whaling ships on rare occasions.

sen.j: 大型鯨が食品とはみなされなくなった後も、イルカについては比較的最近まで食用とされていた。
sen.e: Even after large-sized whales became not to be eaten, dolphin meat continued being eaten until comparatively recently.
While use of Large-sized whales as food had become unpopular, dolphin was considered as food until recently.
While use of Large-sized whales as food had become unpopular, dolphin was considered as food until recently.

sen.j: 15世紀のイングランド家庭料理についての本にもイルカ料理が登場する。
sen.e: Dolphin meat-cooking methods appeared on home-cooking books in England in the 15th century.
Dolphin meat cooking methods appeared on home-cooking books in England in the 15th century.
sen.cmt: 下記の1点変更しました。meat-cooking→meat cooking
sen.e: Dolphin meat cooking methods appeared on home-cooking books in England in the 15th century.

sen.j: イングランドの宮廷では17世紀頃までイルカの鯨肉が供された。
sen.e: Dolphin whale-meat was served in the Imperial court of England until around the 17th century.
Dolphin meat was served in the Imperial court of England until around the 17th century.

sen.e: Dolphin meat was served in the Imperial court of England until around the 17th century.

sen.j: 19世紀に刊行されたハーマン・メルヴィルの「白鯨」にもイルカの美味はよく知られているという記述がある。
sen.e: The description that "it is well known that dolphin meat is tasty" is included even in "Moby Dick" written by Herman Melville and published in the 19th century.
In Herman Melville's "Moby Dick" published in the 19 century, dolphin meat was described as well-known delicacy.
sen.cmt: ※""の部分、「白鯨」本文からの引用ではないと判断しました。誤解が生じないよう、「白鯨」に""内のような記述がある、という表現に改めました。
sen.e: In Herman Melville's "Moby Dick" published in the 19 century, dolphin meat was described as well-known delicacy.

sen.j: なお、「白鯨」には、ある捕鯨船員の特殊な嗜好としてではあるが大型鯨のステーキを食べる描写もある。
sen.e: In "Moby Dick," the scene of sailors on a whale ship eating steaks from a large-sized whale as steak is depicted.
In "Moby Dick" there is also a scene which describes particular taste of a sailor on a whaling ship, and the sailor eat a steak of a large-whale.
sen.cmt: ※「ある捕鯨船船員」(単数）の「特殊な嗜好」である、という表現がされていなかったので改めました。
sen.e: In "Moby Dick" there is also a scene which describes particular taste of a sailor on a whaling ship, and the sailor eat a steak of a large-whale.

sen.j: 同じく19世紀にアメリカの捕鯨船に救助された日本人船員も、アメリカ人船員は大型鯨肉は毒だからと食べないが、イルカはまれに食べていると記録している。
sen.e: Similarly, a Japanese sailor rescued by a whaling ship of the US in the 19th century recorded that American sailors on the ship did not eat the meat of large-sized whales but ate dolphin meat on rare occasions.

Regarding the eating habit of sailors, a Japanese sailor rescued by a whaling ship of the US in the 19th century recorded that American sailors on the ship did not eat the meat of large-sized whales because they considered the meat is bad for them, but ate dolphin meat on rare occasions.
sen.cmt: 下記1点変更しました。Similarly→Regarding the eating habit of sailors 下記1点挿入しました。because they considered the meat is bad for them
sen.e: Regarding the eating habit of sailors, a Japanese sailor rescued by a whaling ship of the US in the 19th century recorded that American sailors on the ship did not eat the meat of large-sized whales because they considered the meat is bad for them, but ate dolphin meat on rare occasions.

sen.j: カトリック教会における小斎のような信仰上の理由から肉食が禁じられているときに、禁忌に触れない「魚」として鯨肉を食べることも多かったようである。
sen.e: It appears that, when eating meat was prohibited for a religious reason, for example, in holy abstinence in the Catholic Church, whale meat was often eaten as fishes that were excluded from the taboo.
It appears that, when eating meat was prohibited for a religious reason, for example, in holy abstinence in the Catholic Church, whale meat was often eaten as fishes that was not considered as taboo.
sen.cmt: 下記1点変更しました。were excluded from the taboo→was not considered as taboo
sen.e: It appears that, when eating meat was prohibited for a religious reason, for example, in holy abstinence in the Catholic Church, whale meat was often eaten as fishes that was not considered as taboo.

sen.j: しかし、沿岸鯨類資源の枯渇から沖合い・遠洋へと漁場が移動するにつれ、冷蔵冷凍技術がない時代には持ち帰りが困難となり、徐々に食用とすることができなくなっていった。
sen.e: However, as whale resources along the coasts became depleted and whales became to be hunt off the coasts or in remote sea areas, it became difficult to bring back caught whales in the ages when no cold storage nor freezing technology was available, making it gradually impossible to eat the meat.

However, as whale resources along the coasts became depleted and sites of whaling changed to off the coasts or in remote sea areas, it became difficult to bring back caught whales in the ages when no cold storage nor freezing technology was available, making it gradually impossible to eat the meat.

sen.e: However, as whale resources along the coasts became depleted and sites of whaling changed to off the coasts or in remote sea areas, it became difficult to bring back caught whales in the ages when no cold storage nor freezing technology was available, making it gradually impossible to eat the meat.

sen.j: なお、鯨肉が利用されなくなったにもかかわらず捕鯨が継続された理由は、鯨油やクジラヒゲなどに工業原料としての価値があったためである。
sen.e: The reason whey whales were hunt even after their meat ceased being eaten was that whale oil and whalebone were useful as industrial materials.
The reason why whales were hunt even after their meat became less and less used as food was that whale oil and whalebone were useful as industrial materials.

sen.e: The reason why whales were hunt even after their meat became less and less used as food was that whale oil and whalebone were useful as industrial materials.

sen.j: そして沿岸から離れる過程で、鯨を食用と見る発想そのものが失われていった。
sen.e: Then in the process in which whales became to be hunted in the sea areas increasingly remoter from coasts, the idea of considering whales as food materials itself was lost.
Then in the process in which whales became to be hunted in the sea areas increasingly remoter from coasts, whales were no more considered as food.
sen.cmt: 下記1点変更しました。the idea of considering whales as food materials itself was lost→whales were no more considered as food
sen.e: Then in the process in which whales became to be hunted in the sea areas increasingly remoter from coasts, whales were no more considered as food.

sen.j: 新鮮な鯨肉が手に入り、なおかつ新鮮な食料を必要としていた捕鯨船上ですら、イルカ以外の大型の鯨については一部の船員を除けば食用とはしていなかった。
sen.e: Even on whaling ships where fresh whale meat was available and fresh food materials were needed as well, large-sized whales except dolphins were not eaten by almost all of the sailors, with rare exceptions.

Even on whaling ships where fresh whale meat was available and fresh food materials were needed as well, large-sized whales except dolphins were not eaten by almost all of the sailors, with rare exceptions.

Even on whaling ships where fresh whale meat was available and fresh food materials were needed as well, large-sized whales except dolphins were not eaten by almost all of the sailors, with rare exceptions.

sen.j: 後に鯨油でマーガリン生産が可能となった時にも、鯨は食品とはみなされていなかったために、鯨製品であるということは秘されて販売されていた。
sen.e: Even when whale oil became to be used for producing margarine later, it was made secrete that margarine was made from whales, because whales were not considered food.
Even when whale oil became to be used for producing margarine later, it was a secret that margarine was made from whales, because whales were not considered food.
sen.cmt: 下記の1点変更しました。it was made secrete→it was a secret
sen.e: Even when whale oil became to be used for producing margarine later, it was a secret that margarine was made from whales, because whales were not considered food.

sen.j: ただしノルウェーやアイスランドなど沿岸での捕鯨が継続された地域では、例外的に鯨肉食が残存している。
sen.e: However, exceptionally, in Norway and Iceland where whaling activities in their coastal areas remain, whale meat has still been eaten.
However, exceptionally, in Norway and Iceland where whaling activities in their coastal areas remain, whale meat has still been eaten.
However, exceptionally, in Norway and Iceland where whaling activities in their coastal areas remain, whale meat has still been eaten.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦時のイギリスなど一部では食糧難の際の代用食として推奨されたが、あまり定着しなかった。
sen.e: In some regions, for example, in the England during World War I,I where food was not available sufficiently, it was recommended to use whale meat as substitute foodstuffs, but such practice did not become established.

In some regions, for example, in the England during World WarⅡ, where food was not available sufficiently, use of whale meet as substitute food was recommended, but such practice didn't become established.

sen.j: 1950年頃にも鯨油価格低下への対応策として鯨肉の商品化が検討されたが、これも失敗に終わり、ペットフードなどに転用された。
sen.e: In around 1950s as well, it was investigated to sell whale meat commercially as a measure against declining whale oil price, but the measure also failed and the meat was sold as food for pets instead.

In around 1950s as well, it was investigated to sell whale meat commercially as a measure against declining whale oil price, but the measure also failed and the meat was sold as food for pets instead.

In around 1950s as well, it was investigated to sell whale meat commercially as a measure against declining whale oil price, but the measure also failed and the meat was sold as food for pets instead.

sen.j: 最近の鯨体の食用利用としては、前述の鯨油マーガリンを除けば、ノルウェーなどが生産した鯨肉エキスを牛肉エキスの代用としてコンソメ原料などに使用していた例がある程度である。
sen.e: In recent years, whale bodies have been used only for consomme (a clear soup), in which whale the meat extract produced in Norway is used as a substitute of beef extract, except the above-described example where whale oil is used for producing margarine.

In recent years, except the case of margarine above, there are not so many examples about the use of whale bodies as food but there is a case that whale extract which produced in Norway was used as substitute for beef extract as ingredient of consomme (a clear soup).

sen.e: In recent years, except the case of margarine above, there are not so many examples about the use of whale bodies as food but there is a case that whale extract which produced in Norway was used as substitute for beef extract as ingredient of consomme (a clear soup).

sen.j: 1577年（天正5年）水野監物が織田信長に鯨肉を贈った、その返礼が信長よりなされており「鯨一折到 来候細々懇 情別而悦入候 猶参上之時 可申候也 正月十六日信長」という内容の感状が書かれている。
sen.e: In 1577, Kenmotsu MIZUNO presented whale meat to Nobunaga ODA, and for this, Nobunaga ODA returned a message including the following description, thanking Mizuno for the present: "I received a pack of whale meat. I was delighted with your kindness. I will express my gratitude when I visit you. By Nobunaga ODA, on February 13, 1577."
sen.cmt: 「鯨一折到 来候細々懇 情別而悦入候 猶参上之時 可申候也 正月十六日信長」： この部分の訳は、自信ありません。
sen.e: In 1577, Kenmotsu MIZUNO presented whale meat to Nobunaga ODA, and for this, Nobunaga ODA returned a message including the following description, thanking Mizuno for the present: "I received a pack of whale meat. I am delighted with your kindness. We'll talk more when you visit me. By Nobunaga ODA, on February 13, 1577."
sen.cmt: 常滑民俗資料館(過去に黒印状の企画展示があった。）に問い合わせ、原文の意味を確認しました。「鯨一折到来候 鯨肉一折到来そうろう（鯨肉が1折届きました。＊折のサイズは不明です1パックといったところでしょう。） 細々懇情別而悦入候 こまごま懇情別して悦び入りそうろう（細かな心遣いをことのほか喜んでいます。） 猶参上之時可申候也 なお参上の時申すべくそうろう（なお、あなたがこちらに参上された時に詳しいお話があります。）」
sen.e: In 1577, Kenmotsu MIZUNO presented whale meat to Nobunaga ODA, and for this, Nobunaga ODA returned a message including the following description, thanking Mizuno for the present: "I received a pack of whale meat. I am delighted with your kindness. We'll talk more when you visit me. By Nobunaga ODA, on February 13, 1577."

sen.j: 「一、領分の船、鯨留め候上、壱疋の内より、初尾の為一尺八寸の皮壱枚宛とらるべく候事 慶長拾七 弐月七日 忠義判 榎倉長兵衛殿」
sen.e: "1. A ship in my territory captured whales, and from one of them, an approx. 58 cm-long skin of the tail was obtained. On March 19, 1612, from Tadayoshi to Mr. Chobei ENOKIKURA."
sen.cmt: 本文の訳は、自信ありません。
sen.e: "1. A ship in my territory captured a whale, since that was the first whale this year, I would like to present an approximately 54.5 cm-long skin. On March 9, 1612, from Tadayoshi to Mr. Chobei ENOKURA."
sen.cmt: ①｢初尾」の解釈 参考：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%88%9D%E5%B0%BE ②「宛とらるべく」の意味がわかりませんが、下記Webサイトを参照し、「献上します」という意味で訳出しました。参考：http://www.mboso-etoko.jp/dictionary/article.php?flg=2&code=105 下記3点修正しました。① 1尺八寸約58cm→54.5cm ② 旧暦2月７日→3月9日(太陽暦）参考：http://koyomi.vis.ne.jp/ ③ ENOKIKURA→ENOKURA
sen.e: "1. A ship in my territory captured a whale, since that was the first whale this year, I would like to present an approximately 54.5 cm-long skin. On March 9, 1612, from Tadayoshi to Mr. Chobei ENOKURA."

sen.j: 鯨の約70もの部位についての料理方法として、「鋤焼き」という焼肉風の料理、すき焼きに似た鍋物、揚げ物などが紹介されている。
sen.e: In the book, the methods of cooking approx. 70 portions of a whale are described, including a roast meat-like dish called "Sukiyaki (鋤焼き)," nabemono (a dish served in a pot at the table) resembling sukiyaki (すき焼き) (thin slices of beef, cooked with various vegetables in a table-top cast-iron pan), and fried dishes.

sen.j: 江戸時代より組織的な捕鯨が行われるようになり、それら捕鯨地域周辺の漁村では、鯨肉は常食とされていた。
sen.e: Entering the Edo period, whales became to be hunt systematically, and whale meat was eaten almost daily by people in the fishing villages around whaling bases.
Entering the Edo period, whaling became more systematically, and whale meat was eaten almost daily by people in the fishing villages around whaling bases.
sen.cmt: 1点変更しました。whales became to be hunt systematically→whaling became more systematically
sen.e: Entering the Edo period, whaling became more systematically, and whale meat was eaten almost daily by people in the fishing villages around whaling bases.

sen.j: ただし、九州地方の一部では、初期の突取式捕鯨期には鯨油生産のみが行われて食用習慣が無く、皮下脂肪以外の鯨肉は沖合いに運んで廃棄していたという記録もある。
sen.e: However, in some parts of Kyushu, whales were only for producing oil and were not eaten in the hand-harpooning whaling era, and the record remains that the whale meat except subcutaneous fat were carried off the coasts and were dumped there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: しかしながら、その九州でも網取式捕鯨が始まる頃までには急速に鯨肉食が盛んになる。
sen.e: However, even in Kyushu, lots of whale meat became to be eaten by around the time when net-using whaling started.

sen.j: 例えば幕末に捕鯨地の長崎県を訪れたフィリップ・フランツ・フォン・シーボルトも、しばしば鯨料理が供されたことについての記録を残しており、中には「鯨ひげのサラダ」などの特異な献立も記されている。
sen.e: For example, Philipp Franz von Siebold who visited Nagasaki Prefecture, where a whaling base existed, towards the end of the Edo period, recorded that he was often served with whale-based dishes, in particular recording a unique menu of "whalebone salad."

For example, at the end of Edo Period, Philipp Franz von Siebold visited Nagasaki Prefecture, where a whaling base existed and recorded that he was often served whale-based dishes, in particular a unique menu of "whalebone salad."

sen.e: For example, at the end of Edo Period, Philipp Franz von Siebold visited Nagasaki Prefecture, where a whaling base existed and recorded that he was often served whale-based dishes, in particular a unique menu of "whalebone salad."

sen.j: ツチクジラは、現在の千葉県房総半島太平洋岸のように、該当種の捕鯨が行われてきた地域では古くから食べられ、特有のクセに応じた調理法も工夫されてきた（鯨肉の干物の「鯨のたれ」と呼ばれる加工品など）。
sen.e: Berardius was eaten from old times in the areas where the whales of this type were hunt, for example, in the coast of the Pacific ocean in the Boso peninsular of Chiba Prefecture, and cooking methods effective for the taste specific to these whales were invented (for example, processed (dried) whale meat called "kujira no tare").

sen.j: 流通の常（つね）で生産地の周辺地域に広く消費される傾向にあるが、大阪など近傍経済圏にもこの頃に生まれた伝統的な鯨肉料理が存在する。
sen.e: Whale meat, as well as other goods, tends to be consumed around the area where it is produced, but traditional whale meat-based dishes, invented in this era, also exist in the economic regions, such as Osaka, near to a production site.

sen.e: In the area around the Edo castle, "kujira nabe" (a dish served in a pot), "miso soup," and "clear soup," all of which were based on whale meat, were eaten, and a delicacy that was made from the cartilages of whale heads and was called "horihori" or "Kujira-noshi" was also sold.

sen.j: 全体的な傾向としてはシロデモノと総称された皮下脂肪や尾羽が好まれ、尾の身も高級品とされていた。
sen.e: Generally, subcutaneous fat called "shirodemono" and oba (tail fins) were favored, and meat of the tail was valued as top quality products.

sen.j: 秋田県でも鍋物としては珍しく夏の暑気払いとして「鯨貝焼（くじらかやき）」という鯨のしょっつる鍋が江戸時代から食されており、夏場になると五艘程度の小舟の船団で鯨漁に出ていた記録が残されている。
sen.e: In Akita Prefecture, shottsuru-nabe (soy sauce-based nabemono) of whale meat called "kujira-yaki," a rare nabemono in the summer season, has been eaten since the Edo period, and it is recorded that a group of around five ships went to sea to hunt whales.

sen.j: そして明治開拓以降の北海道の日本海側各地で正月料理として鯨汁が食されるのは、秋田藩を中心とした東北の人々が移り住んだ名残といわれている。
sen.e: In various areas on the Japan Sea side of Hokkaido, Kujira-jiru has been eaten as New Year's dishes since the era when Hokkai started being developed in the Meiji period, and it is said that this habit originated in the people who moved there from the Tohoku region, centered on the Akita domain.

sen.j: 北海道のアイヌ民族の鯨食は江戸時代よりも古いとされる。

sen.e: Similarly, whale meat was eaten in Doyo (the dog days of summer) in various parts of Japan, and in some villages in Kyushu, each household preserved a barrel of whale skin in salt.

sen.j: 塩蔵すれば魚類よりも長期間の保存・輸送に耐えることを活かして、少量は各地に輸送された。

sen.j: 一般の海魚の運ばれない山村等で正月などハレとケ（晴れの席）の料理に供されていた例もある。

sen.j: 江戸時代には、江戸の日本橋 (東京都中央区)の魚市では「大には鯨、小には鰯、貴品には鯛、鰈等があるなかにも堅魚は近海の名産にして、四月八日の初市には、衣を典し衿を売るも必ずこれを食ふの旧習民間に行はる」という言葉が残されており、江戸城下で鯨肉が広く一般に流通していたことがうかがえる。
sen.e: In the fish market at Nihonbashi (present Chuo Ward, Tokyo) in the Edo period, the following was said, showing that whale meat was available widely in the areas around the Edo castle: "If you want big fishes, there are whales, if you want small fishes, there are sardines, if you want precious fishes, there are sea breams and flounders, but bonitoes are excellent inshore fishes, and people always eat bonitoes as a traditional custom at the first fair of selling them on April 8, even if they have to pawn their clothes or to sell their collars."

In the fish market at Nihonbashi (present Chuo Ward, Tokyo) in the Edo period, the following was said, showing that whale meat was available widely in the areas around the Edo castle: "If you want big fishes, there are whales, if you want small fishes, there are sardines, if you want precious fishes, there are sea breams and flounders, but skipjack tunas are excellent inshore fishes, and people always eat skipjack tunas as a traditional custom at the first fair of selling them on April 8, even if they have to pawn their clothes or to sell their collars."
sen.cmt: ※用語集に従い「堅魚」→skipjack tunaに改めました。また、堅魚は鰹節をさすようですが、（参考：http://www.katsuobushi-kyo.or.jp/yaizukatsuo.html）、Webで検索しても4月8日の初市に生の鰹が売られていたのか鰹節なのか判断がつかないため、「鰹」として訳出しています。
sen.e: In the fish market at Nihonbashi (present Chuo Ward, Tokyo) in the Edo period, the following was said, showing that whale meat was available widely in the areas around the Edo castle: "If you want big fishes, there are whales, if you want small fishes, there are sardines, if you want precious fishes, there are sea breams and flounders, but skipjack tunas are excellent inshore fishes, and people always eat skipjack tunas as a traditional custom at the first fair of selling them on April 8, even if they have to pawn their clothes or to sell their collars."

sen.j: 別の文献によると、土佐の捕鯨地からは、近傍の土佐中心部のほか一大消費地である大阪圏へも多量の鯨肉が供給されており、初物をいち早く出荷するべく業者が競っていたと言う。
sen.e: According to another historical document, it is said that, from the Tosa whaling base, lots of whale meat was supplied to the Osaka area, a big consuming region, in addition to the central part of Tosa located near to the base, and whale meat vendors there competed with each other to deliver first bonitos in the season as early as possible to the region.

sen.cmt: ※「初物」がfirst bonitos「初鰹」となっていますが、ここでは「鯨肉」のことを指していると思われるので、first whaleに変更しました。

sen.j: 冬が本場の鯨漁から「鯨九十九日」という言葉が古くから残されており鯨肉の日持ちの良さを表した言葉である。
sen.e: In the whale business, which was centered on the winter, it has been said from old times that "whale meat is eatable for 99 days," showing that whale meat can be kept for a long time.

sen.j: オランダで1832年(天保3年)に刊行されたシーボルト著の「江戸参府紀行」によれば鯨は水揚げされたあと、鯨肉など食用にされる部分は各々の魚商が買い上げ新鮮なうちに、日本中の港に運ばれたと記述している。
sen.e: "Edo Sanpu Kiko" written by Siebold and published in 1832 in the Netherlands includes the following description: After whales were captured, their eatable parts were bought by fish-mongers, and were carried to various ports in Japan while the meat was still fresh.

sen.j: 前掲の「料理食道記」（1669年）には、鯨肉産地として伊勢国や紀伊国、肥前国のほか、松前藩焼鯨(北海道のアイヌによる製品)、出雲国かぶら骨(頭部の軟骨)などが挙げられている。
sen.e: In the "Ryori shokudo-ki" (published in 1669) described above, the Ise province, the Kii province and the Hizen province were listed as whale meat-producing areas, and in addition, roast whale meat in the Matsumae domain (products by the Ainu in Hokkaido) and Kabura-bone (cartridges of whale heads) in the Izumo province were also described.

sen.j: 他に、現在の岩手県、静岡県、和歌山県や四国、東北、北陸地方の一部、沖縄県の北部など捕鯨日本における捕鯨が伝統的に行われている地方では、古くからイルカ肉も流通している。
sen.e: In addition, in the areas where whales have been hunted traditionally in whaling Japan, such as present Iwate Prefecture, Shizuoka Prefecture, Wakayama Prefecture, and some parts of Shikoku, of Tohoku and of Hokuriku, dolphin meat has also been distributed since old times.

sen.j: 大型のクジラの鯨肉に比べると地域性の強い食文化であり、特にそれらの地域では重要な地位にあったといえる。
sen.e: Dolphin meat-based dishes, compared with those based on large-sized whales, were strongly dependent on the area where they were eaten, and it can be said that they constituted an important position in the dishes in those areas.

sen.e: As described above, whale meat was used as a gift among busho (Japanese military commanders) in the Sengoku period, was ranked number one of the fishes in a rating of foodstuffs, and was positioned as an item to be used on auspicious occasions, such as the New Year and the ends of seasons.

sen.j: 鯨肉の汚染問題
sen.e: Problems of polluted whale meat
Problems of polluted whale meat
Problems of polluted whale meat

sen.j: 生物濃縮により人体に有害な重金属やポリ塩化ビフェニル(PCB)類などがクジラの体内に蓄積されているので、鯨肉は汚染されているとの指摘があり、一部の国では摂食制限が行われている。
sen.e: It has been pointed out that whale meat has been polluted because heavy metal and polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB) have been accumulated in whale bodies through bioaccumulation, and eating whale meat has been restricted in some nations.

It has been pointed out that whale meat has been polluted because heavy metal and polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB) have been accumulated in whale bodies through bioaccumulation, and eating whale meat has been restricted in some nations.

sen.j: 日本でも、水銀の含有濃度が高いハクジラ類については、キンメダイなど他の魚介類と並んで、妊婦を対象とした摂取量に関するガイドラインが定められている。
sen.e: Concerning the odontoceti in which lots of mercury has been accumulated, guidelines for the eatable amount of the whale meat, together with those of other fishes and shells, including bigeye snapper, have been specified in Japan as well, targeting at pregnant women.

sen.e: Concerning the odontoceti in which lots of mercury has been accumulated, guidelines for the eatable amount of the whale meat, together with those of other fishes and shells, including alfonsin, have been specified in Japan as well, targeting at pregnant women.

sen.j: 他方、ヒゲクジラ類については比較的有害物質の含有濃度は低く、特に南極海で捕獲されたものに関してはほとんど蓄積が無いことから、特段の制限は設けられていない。
sen.e: On the other hand, concerning baleen whales, no specific restrictions are imposed, because relatively small amounts of harmful substances are accumulated in these whales and in particular, almost no harmful substances are accumulated in the whale caught in the Antarctic ocean.

sen.e: The restriction on odontoceti, concerned with the eatable amount of the meat, is targeted only at pregnant women, and concerning the eating of the meat by ordinary people, it is said that no problem exists even for infants and breast-feeding women.

sen.j: 日本では鯨肥と呼ばれる肥料の原料として使用された。
sen.e: In Japan, whale meat has been used as a material to produce a fertilizer called Geihi (literally, whale-based fertilizer).
In Japan, whale meat has been used as a material to produce a fertilizer called Geihi (literally, whale-based fertilizer).
In Japan, whale meat has been used as a material to produce a fertilizer called Geihi (literally, whale-based fertilizer).

sen.j: 鯨肉・鯨骨・鯨皮などを煮て石臼などで粉砕したものであり、鰯肥などと同様の海産肥料として使われた。
sen.e: The fertilizer is produced by boiling whale meat, whale bones and whale skins, and then grinding them with a stone mill, and has been used as a marine fertilizer together with the sardine-based fertilizer.

The fertilizer is produced by boiling whale meat, whale bones and whale skins, and then grinding them with a stone mill, and has been used as a marine fertilizer together with the sardine-based fertilizer.

sen.j: 江戸時代から鯨油の絞り粕の再利用等として行われている。
sen.e: Since the Edo period, this fertilizer has been produced from the whale meat from which oil has been extracted.
Since the Edo period, this fertilizer has been produced from the whale meat from which oil has been extracted.

sen.j: 明治時代以降に近代捕鯨基地として使われた宮城県牡鹿町鮎川浜（現石巻市）などでは、鯨肥生産が地場産業として栄えていた。
sen.e: In Ayukawahama, Oshika Town, (present Ishinomaki City), Miyagi prefecture, used as a modern whaling base from the Meiji period, Geihi production flourished as a local industry.
In Ayukawahama, Oshika Town, (present Ishinomaki City), Miyagi prefecture, used as a modern whaling base from the Meiji period, Geihi production flourished as a local industry.

sen.j: 鮎川浜の場合、食用に適さないマッコウクジラが対象鯨種であった。
sen.e: In Ayukawahama, sperm whales not fit for eating were caught mostly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Ayukawahama, sperm whales not fit for eating were caught mostly.
In Ayukawahama, sperm whales not fit for eating were caught mostly.

sen.j: そのため、食用とされた鯨肉はごく一部であり、余剰鯨肉が生じていた。
sen.e: Therefore, only a small portion of the whale meat was eaten, generating surplus whale meat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, only a small portion of the whale meat was eaten, generating surplus whale meat.
Therefore, only a small portion of the whale meat was eaten, generating surplus whale meat.

sen.j: これらは当初は海洋投棄されていた。
sen.e: The surplus meat was dumped to the sea initially.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The surplus meat was dumped to the sea initially.
The surplus meat was dumped to the sea initially.

sen.j: しかしながら、周辺海面を汚染するとして地元漁民の反発を受けたこともあって工業資源化され成功したものである。
sen.e: However, as such an act was complained by local fishermen as polluting the sea surface around the dumping site, the meat became used as an industrial material successfully.
